result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Todd J. Vandeneng

records.addlTxt: Order on Motion to seal/redact court record

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: NOT ON RECORD - JA TOOK UP. Defendant Todd J. Vandeneng in court. Prosecuting Atty Alex E. Johnson appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Defendant wants a pro bono attorney, but not willing to accept SPD or dean appointed attorney. Defendant wants to represent himself. Court advises defendant must file discovery demand in writing with DA's office. Atty Johnson, has not had a request from the defendant for discovery, defendant has only been sent the criminal complaint. Victims are present in court, state they called 911 during the incident. Defendant requests jury trial. Atty Johnson advises the defendant has not completed fingerprints and photographs. Court orders defendant contact jail today to set up an appointment for fingerprints and photographs. Address and phone checked. PTC date set, on record. Blue card given.
Pre-trial conference on November 15, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
and Motion for Pretrial Orders - Atty Nguyen

records.descr: Order on motion to seal/redact court record

records.addlTxt: Order on Motion to Seal or Redact Court Record

The defendant shall appear on all court dates; give written notice to the Clerk of Court  within 48 hours of any change of address or telephone number;  shall not commit any crime; shall neither directly nor indirectly threaten, harass, intimidate or otherwise interfere with victims or witnesses in this action.  Call the Outagamie County Sheriff's Dept. at (920) 832-5633 within 48 hours for fingerprints and/or photos (to be completed within 21 days).
Defendant waives right to attorney.  Not Guilty Plea entered - pretrial conference date set.
Pre-trial conference on September 14, 2022 at 09:30 am.
